text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President Glafcos Clerides submits suggestions to the United Nations to boost bicommunal exchanges through professional organisations.

- Communist Akel leader Demetris Christofias calls for rapproachement between Greek and Turkish Cypriots at the unveiling of a statue of a Greek and a Turkish Cypriot gunned down by a Turkish Cypriot militant group 32 years ago.
- The United Nations is seeking "common ground" on the positions of the two sides on the way it will go about holding direct talks between them.
- The government is looking at the possibility of allowing the overnight stay of tourists in the occupied areas as a goodwill gesture to the Turkish Cypriot side during proximity talks.
- Clerides keeps his cards close to his chest on the possibility of a cabinet reshuffle.
- Right wing Disy vice-president Nicos Anastassiades criticises incumbent chairman Yiannakis Matsis, saying there are people in the party who are undermining the (Disy led) government
